metadata.title: CVE-2017-7500 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
It was found that rpm did not properly handle RPM installations when adestination path was a symbolic link to a directory, possibly changingownership and permissions of an arbitrary directory, and RPM files beingplaced in an arbitrary destination. An attacker, with write access to adirectory in which a subdirectory will be installed, could redirect thatdirectory to an arbitrary location and gain root privilege.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7500` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

librpm9 - 4.16.1.2+dfsg1-0.6
librpmbuild9 - 4.16.1.2+dfsg1-0.6
librpmio9 - 4.16.1.2+dfsg1-0.6
librpmsign9 - 4.16.1.2+dfsg1-0.6
python3-rpm - 4.16.1.2+dfsg1-0.6
rpm - 4.16.1.2+dfsg1-0.6
rpm-common - 4.16.1.2+dfsg1-0.6
rpm-i18n - 4.16.1.2+dfsg1-0.6
rpm2cpio - 4.16.1.2+dfsg1-0.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rpm package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.16.1.2+dfsg1-0.6').
